alert.note: Alert for Meigs (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 1:41PM EST until February 20 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... West Virginia... Ohio River At Belleville Lock affecting Meigs, Wood and Jackson Counties. For the Ohio River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River At Belleville Lock. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Ohio State Route 124 is flooded north of Stiversville Road, at Rock Run, at Wells Run to Smith Ridge to Dewitts Run, at Forked Run, at Curtis Hollow Road and between Long Bottom and Shade River. Ohio State Route 124 near the Washington and Meigs County line is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM EST Saturday the stage was 36.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:00 PM EST Saturday was 36.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 36.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 36.5 feet on 02/09/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued late tonight at midnight.
